make a 23cm x 23cm square written permission of the designer this pattern uses us terminology with for questions relating to permission or usage ema il metric sizes hosteam@hookedonsunshine co before you begin crocheting always read through the pattern first to give you a better understanding of what you will colours are for reference only and will need to do vary based on lighting monitor settings it is important to always keep track of and devices stitch counts while working the pattern kits and videos available here 1 m at eri als ➢ any yarn of your choice i used colourspun dk cotton ➢ 4mm hook or hook compatible with yarn used ➢ needle for sewing in ends and needle joins yar n colours an d qu anti ti es ➢ if you have purchased a yarn kit you will need to match my gauge or you may run short of yarn ➢ if you are using your own yarn it is not imperative that you match my gauge but it is important to keep your gauge even throughout your project for best results ➢ you will need approximately 50 grams to complete the square ➢ your square should measure 23cm when complete ➢ a 3-round solid double_crochet square = 7cm you can find a full video tutorial of the square on the
